execution_summary: I generated the runtime Dockerfile, built the image, started the container, and executed the Python analysis entrypoint analyze__py.py (human-approved). The analyze__py.py script ran successfully (exit code 0) and produced four output files (test/real × drop/keep wave 7). The preregistered focal hypothesis concerns the effect of polarization (sd_gov) among strong democracies (Polity IV >= 9). The executed analysis (analyze__py.py) did not subset to strong democracies; it ran on the provided sample and produced the results reported below. Overall the replication run completed successfully, but the executed specification does not match the preregistration restriction to strong democracies, so results are only partially aligned with the preregistration.

code_executed.logs: Script printed: Wrote results to /workspace/replication_data/output/test_drop_7.txt; Wrote results to /workspace/replication_data/output/test_keep_7.txt; Wrote results to /workspace/replication_data/output/real_drop_7.txt; Wrote results to /workspace/replication_data/output/real_keep_7.txt. Exit code: 0. No stderr output.
code_executed.environment: Docker image based on python:3.10-slim with pandas>=1.3.0, numpy>=1.21.0, statsmodels>=0.13.0 (runtime user: runner).

results.hypothesis_tested: Preregistered hypothesis: Among strong democracies (Polity IV score >= 9), polarization (measured by sd_gov) will be negatively associated with the size of government (gov_consumption). Note: the executed script did not apply the strong-democracy subset; the results below are from the full sample runs produced by analyze__py.py.

tables.table_description: Regression coefficients (robust SE) for gov_consumption on sd_gov and covariates; produced by analyze__py.py, full-sample, keeping wave 7.
Regression coefficients (robust SE) for gov_consumption on sd_gov and covariates; produced by analyze__py.py, dropping wave 7.
